name: comfrey
content:
Add to word list

a plant with large leaves covered in hairs and white, pink, or purple flowers, sometimes used as a herb to treat medical conditions : Each plant can re-root, and comfrey can be a very difficult plant to get rid of. Comfrey should also be regularly watered until well established.
More examplesFewer examplesThe 6-foot-long roots that harvest nutrients from deep in the soil make comfrey leaves a fantastic natural source of nitrogen, phosphorus, and potassium.All comfreys grow fast, and you can harvest at least two crops of leaves during the growing season.Also known as knitbone, comfrey has a good reputation as a wound healer.Comfrey is a key plant in organic gardening as it is an excellent fertilizer, rich in trace elements.
